alert.note: Alert for Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 27 at 12:23PM MDT until April 28 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 3 PM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of generally 2 to 4 inches with locally up to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass. * WHEN...From 3 AM to 3 PM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-25. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches and also create areas of blowing snow that will further reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
